definitions.explanation_en: A masculine given name of Greek origin, derived from the name Iason (Ἰάσων), meaning 'healer'. It is most famously associated with the mythological hero Jason, who led the Argonauts in search of the Golden Fleece.
definitions.explanation_cn: 源自希腊语的男性名字，源于 Iason（Ἰάσων），意为“治愈者”。最著名的是希腊神话中的英雄杰森，他率领阿尔戈英雄们寻找金羊毛。
definitions.example_en: Jason was the courageous leader of the Argonauts in ancient Greek mythology.
definitions.example_cn: 在古希腊神话中，杰森是阿尔戈英雄们勇敢的领袖。

definitions.explanation_en: A modern personal name used in English-speaking countries, often associated with traits such as strength, adventure, or leadership due to its mythological roots.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在英语国家中作为现代人名使用，常因神话渊源而与力量、冒险或领导力等特质相关联。
definitions.example_en: My neighbor's son is named Jason—he's already captain of his high school soccer team.
definitions.example_cn: 我邻居的儿子叫杰森——他已经是高中足球队的队长了。

comparison.analysis: “Jason” 是一个专有名词，特指人名，不具备普通名词的语义功能。它与其他常见名词（如 example、develop）在词性和用法上完全不同，不能作为普通词汇进行语义比较。其唯一性在于文化与神话背景，而非语言结构。
